intro: Tridax moorei, commonly known as the slender tridax, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, attracting various pollinators. Tridax moorei is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural areas.
